problem_prompt: Solve the following problem. What is the 308th digit to the right of the decimal point when $\frac{12}{37}$ is expressed as a decimal?
solution: We use long division to find that the decimal representation of $\frac{12}{37}$ is $0.\overline{324}$. When $308$ is divided by $3$ there is a remainder of $2$ $\left( 308\div 3=102 \ R2\right)$. Therefore the 308th digit to the right of the decimal point is the second digit of $324$, which is $\boxed{2}$.
gpt_response:
To find the decimal representation of $\frac{12}{37}$, we perform long division:

\[
\begin{array}{r|c@{\hspace{4pt}}c@{\hspace{4pt}}c}
\cline{2-4}
37 & 12. &  \hspace{5pt} \text{
} \hspace{5pt}  \\
\cline{2-4}
37 & 12. &  \hspace{5pt}                   \\   
\cline{2-4}             
    & 0 & \hspace{5pt}6 \hspace{5pt}  \\
    & \underline{0} \\
    & 0 & 24 &  \\
    & \underline{22} & \hspace{5pt}2 \\
    & 0 & \hspace{5pt} 20 \\
    & \underline{18} & \hspace{5pt} 37 \\
    & 1 & \hspace{5pt} 30 \\
    & \underline{1} & \hspace{5pt} 11 \\
    & & 195 \\
    & & \underline{185} \\
    & & 10 \\
    & & \underline{ 111} \\
    & & 94 \\
    & & \underline{ 74} \\
    & & 200 \\
    & & \underline{ 185} \\
    & & 15 \\
\end{array}
\]

The long division results in the following decimal expansion for $\frac{12}{37}:$

$$\frac{12}{37} \approx 0.324324324324\ldots$$

Since $324$ is a repeating block, every third digit after the decimal point will be a $4$. The $308$th digit to the right of the decimal point will be the $1$st digit in the repeating block, which is a $\boxed{2}$.
